data.title: ELPAC Training - ATC Communication Simulation
data.description: Practice standard ATC phraseology and procedures for the ELPAC exam

steps.prompt: Establish initial contact with the aircraft. Choose the correct radio phraseology:

choices.text: Welcome to ICAO Tower, what is your position?
choices.feedback: Correct! This is the standard way to initiate contact.

choices.text: Hello aircraft, what do you want?
choices.feedback: Incorrect. Always use proper radio phraseology.

steps.prompt: Provide departure clearance to the aircraft. Select the correct phraseology:

choices.text: Cleared for takeoff runway 27L, wind 270 at 10 knots, temperature 20, QNH 1013
choices.feedback: Correct! Clear and concise clearance given with all necessary information.
Incorrect. Must use proper clearance phraseology including all required elements.

data.title: ELPAC Training - Emergency Response Simulation
data.description: Practice handling emergency situations in ATC communications

steps.prompt: An aircraft has declared an emergency. Choose the correct response:

choices.feedback: Correct! Always ask for the nature of emergency first.

steps.prompt: Coordinate emergency landing procedures. Select the correct phraseology:

choices.text: Cleared emergency landing runway 27L, emergency services standing by
choices.feedback: Correct! Proper coordination with emergency services.

choices.text: Land on any runway you want
choices.feedback: Incorrect. Must specify runway and coordinate with emergency services.

steps.prompt: Request weather information. Choose the correct phraseology:

choices.text: Request weather information for destination airport
choices.feedback: Correct! Clear and professional request for weather information.

steps.prompt: Report your position. Select the correct phraseology:

choices.text: Position report: 50 miles north of ICAO, FL350, estimating next waypoint in 15 minutes
choices.feedback: Correct! Complete position report with all required elements.
Incorrect. Must provide specific position details.

data.title: TEA Training - Non-Routine Communication Simulation
data.description: Practice handling non-routine situations in aviation

steps.prompt: Report a technical problem. Choose the correct phraseology:

choices.text: We have a technical issue with the number two engine. Oil pressure is fluctuating and temperature is rising
choices.feedback: Correct! Clear description of the problem with specific details.
Incorrect. Must provide specific details about the problem.

steps.prompt: Request maintenance assistance. Select the correct phraseology:

choices.text: Request maintenance assistance at destination. Need technical inspection of number two engine
choices.feedback: Correct! Clear request with specific requirements.
Incorrect. Must specify the type of assistance needed.
